title: Bond Yields Rise, Stock Futures Fall After Inflation Data; Tech stocks seen ticking lower after Nasdaq jumps over 2%
text:
Bond yields jumped after the data. Yields on 10-year Treasury notes rose to 1.984% from 1.928% Wednesday. The yield on two-year notes, which are particularly sensitive to interest rates, rose to 1.436% from 1.346%.

Inflation accelerated to a 7.5% annual rate in January, topping economists' forecasts and December's 7% pace.

Ahead of the opening bell, Twitter shares rose 8.5% after the social-media company said it had largely dodged the effect of privacy changes hurting Facebook parent Meta Platforms. Walt Disney jumped 7.6% after it reported 11.8 million new subscribers for its Disney+ streaming service in the fourth quarter. Uber Technologies, meanwhile, gained 4.5% after the ride-hailing firm said quarterly revenue climbed 83%.

Among other individual stocks, Twilio jumped 19% premarket after the software company said revenue and profits topped analysts' forecasts. Mattel also topped forecasts, sending shares of the toy maker 11% higher. PepsiCo added 1.1% after raising its dividend and setting a $10 billion stock buyback program.

Overseas stock markets were mixed. The Stoxx Europe 600 was flat as gains for real-estate stocks offset losses for shares of media and financial-service companies.

Siemens rose 6.1% after the German industrial company said rising orders goosed quarterly revenue and profits. Société Générale said profits climbed in the final quarter of 2021, lifting shares 4.7%. Delivery Hero plunged 22% after the German food-delivery firm said it lost money in 2021.

In Asia, Japan's Nikkei 225 added 0.4% and the Shanghai Composite ticked up 0.2%. In Hong Kong, China Evergrande shares rose 5.4% after reports that the embattled property company plans to restore construction and sales activity, while refraining from a fire sale of its assets.

Write to Joe Wallace at joe.wallace@wsj.com
